trans-unit.source: …text is actually visible to the user
…text is present in the HTML source

“WebDriver” is the name of a protocol (specified by W3C) to drive browsers automatically. This specification is implemented for all modern desktop and mobile browsers. Codeception uses facebook/php-webdriver library from Facebook as PHP implementation of WebDriver protocol.
<ul><li>For WebDriver: Selenium Server or PhantomJS (deprecated)</li><li>For PhpBrowser: None</li></ul>
(you can also use Laravel5 and Phalcon).
Interactive Pause is a REPL that allows to type and check commands for instant feedback.
Cest format can also be used for integration testing. In some cases it makes tests cleaner as it simplifies module access by using common $I-> syntax:

Selenium Server is a de-facto standard for automated web and mobile testing. It is a server that can launch and drive different browsers locally or remotely. WebDriver protocol was initially created by Selenium before becoming a W3C standard. This makes Selenium server the most stable complete implementation of WebDriver for today. Selenium Server is also recommended by Codeception team.
Recorder Extension allows to record tests step-by-steps and show them in slideshow

AspectMock is an advanced mocking framework which allows you to replace any methods of any class in a test. Static methods, class methods, date and time functions can be easily replaced with AspectMock. For instance, you can test singletons!
ConditionalAssertion - failed assertion will be logged, but test will continue.
Retry - failed action will be retried automatically.
Jenkins is one of the most popular open-source solution on market. It is easy to setup and is easy to customize by applying various plugins.
$button could be any one of the following:
$xml->__toString - get a string representation of XML.
$xml->node->val('value') - sets the inner value of node
$xml->node - create new xml node and go inside of it.
$xml->parents('user') - go back through all parents to user node.

@dataprovider annotation is also available for unit tests, in this case the data provider method must be public. For more details about how to use data provider for unit tests, please refer to PHPUnit documentation.

@depends applies to the Cest and Codeception\Test\Unit formats. Dependencies can be set across different classes. To specify a dependent test from another file you should provide a test signature. Normally, the test signature matches the className:methodName format. But to get the exact test signature just run the test with the --steps option to see it:

AdditionalSteps file should be accessible by autoloader and can be created by Codeception\Lib\Di. This means that practically any class can be a context. If a class receives an actor class in constructor or in _inject method, DI can inject it into it.
Codeception\Scenario is also available in Actor classes and StepObjects. You can access it with $this->getScenario().
_after method is executed after each test (like tearDown in PHPUnit)
_before method is executed before each test (like setUp in PHPUnit)
_failed will be executed on failed test
_passed will be executed on passed test
_reconfigure - can be implemented instead of overriding the constructor
actor: name of the actor class for current suite.

actor_suffix: Tester: changes suffix for Actor classes. This defines a rule to generate new test suites. If you change Tester to Ninja, and generate new api test suite, you will get ApiNinja actor class.
capabilities - Sets Selenium desired capabilities. Should be a key-value array.
cleanup - (default: true) cleanup fixtures after the test
clear_cookies - Set to false to keep cookies, or set to true (default) to delete all cookies between tests.
codecept bootstrap --actor Wizard - sets actor as Wizard, to have TestWizard actor in tests.
codecept bootstrap --namespace Frontend - creates tests, and use Frontend namespace for actor classes and helpers.
codecept bootstrap path/to/the/project - provide different path to a project, where tests should be placed
codecept bootstrap - creates tests dir and codeception.yml in current dir.
codecept config:validate -c another_config.yml: from another config file
codecept console acceptance - starts acceptance suite environment. If you use WebDriver you can manipulate browser with Codeception commands.
codecept g:scenarios acceptance --format html - in html format
codecept g:scenarios acceptance --path doc - generate scenarios to doc dir
codecept g:scenarios acceptance - for all acceptance tests
codecept g:stepobject acceptance UserSteps --silent - skip action questions
codecept gherkin:snippets acceptance user_account.feature - snippets from a single feature file
codecept gherkin:snippets acceptance/feature/users/user_accout.feature - snippets from feature file in a dir
codecept gherkin:snippets acceptance/feature/users - snippets from feature/users dir of acceptance tests
codecept gherkin:snippets acceptance - snippets from all feature of acceptance tests
codecept run --debug: print steps and debug information
codecept run --ext "My\Custom\Extension" run with an extension loaded by class name
codecept run --ext DotReporter run with DotReporter printer
codecept run --ext Recorder run with Recorder extension enabled
codecept run -c another_config.yml: from another config file
codecept run acceptance -g slow: run tests from slow group
codecept run acceptance MyCept: same as above
codecept run acceptance MyCest:myTestInIt: run one test from a Cest
codecept run acceptance: run all acceptance tests
codecept run unit,functional: run only unit and functional suites
configFilerequired - the path to the application config file. File should be configured for test environment and return configuration array.
connection_timeout - timeout for opening a connection to remote selenium server (30 seconds by default).
container - (default: config/container.php) relative path to file which returns Container
debug_log_entries - how many selenium entries to print with debugWebDriverLogs or on fail (15 by default).
entryScript - front script title (like: index-test.php). If not set - taken from entryUrl.
error_level can also be set globally in codeception.yml file.
error_level: error level for runner in current suite. Should be specified for unit, integration, functional tests. Passes value to error_reporting function.
extends: allows you to specify a file (relative to the *.suite.yml file) that holds some already pre-defined values. This can be used to always use the same configuration for modules or whatever.
extends: allows you to specify a file (relative to the codeception.yml file) that holds some already pre-defined values. This can be used to always use the same configuration for modules or whatever.
extensions: allows to enable and configure Codeception extensions, Group Objects, and Custom Commands.
fixtures - use fixtures inside tests with haveFixtures/grabFixture/grabFixtures actions.
fixturesMethod - (default: _fixtures) Name of the method used for creating fixtures.
formats: formats with the list of extra test format classes.
generate:scenariossuite - Generates text files containing scenarios from tests
generate:suitesuiteactor - Generates a new suite with the given Actor class name
generate:testsuitefilename - Generates a sample PHPUnit Test with Codeception hooks
getModule - allows you to access a module
groups: groups with the list of tests of for corresponding group.
hasModule - checks if a module is enabled
haveInDatabase inserts a row with the provided values into the database. All added records will be deleted at the end of the test.
http_proxy - sets http proxy server url for testing a remote server.
ignoreCollidingDSN - (default: false) When 2 database connections use the same DSN but different settings an exception will be thrown, set this to true to disable this behavior.
include: []: include additional Codeception configurations for multiple applications setup.
init - use module only for initialization (for acceptance tests).
integer:>{val} - checks that integer is greater than {val} (works with float and string types too).
integer:<{val} - checks that integer is lower than {val} (works with float and string types too).
log_js_errors - Set to true to include possible JavaScript to HTML report, or set to false (default) to deactivate.
modules: allows to create shared module configuration for all included suites.
modules: list of enabled modules with their configuration.
namespace: default namespace of actor, support classes and tests.
namespace: set a namespace for tests. All new tests and support classes will be generated under that namespace. Allows to configure multiple test setups for one runner.
pageload_timeout - amount of time to wait for a page load to complete before throwing an error (default 0 seconds).
param Boolean $first Whether to return the first value or all header values
param RemoteWebDriver $page WebDriver instance or an element to search within

param array $files A list of filenames or “mocks” of $_FILES (each entry being an array with the following keys: name, type, error, size, tmp_name (pointing to the real file path). Each key works as the “name” attribute of a file input field.
param array $linkEntries (entry is array with keys “uri” and “link-param”)
param array $linkEntries (entry is array with keys “uri” and “link-param”) @link http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2068#section-19.6.2.4 @author samva.ua@gmail.com
param array $params - properties and methods to set
param array $params Additional cookie params like domain, path, expires and secure.
param bool $prepend If true, prepend the base directory to the stack instead of appending it; this causes it to be searched first rather than last.
param mixed $class - A class to be mocked
param mixed $value Optional. If specified, also checks the key has this value. Booleans will be converted to 1 and 0 (even inside arrays)
param null $itemValue Optional and only used for zsets and hashes. If specified, the method will also check that the $item has this value/score
param null $jsonPath optionally set specific path to structure with JsonPath @see seeResponseMatchesJsonType
param string $base_dir A base directory for class files in the namespace.
param string $cssOrXPath css or xpath of the web element
param string $cssOrXPath css or xpath of the web element (body by default).
param string $name The name of the cookie
param string $name the name of the header to delete.
param string $name the name of the request header
param string $type The type of the key
param string $val The value of the CSRF token
param string $value The value of the cookie
param string $value the value to set it to for subsequent requests
param $algo the hash algorithm to use. Default md5.
param $char string|array Can be char or array with modifier. You can provide several chars. @throws \Codeception\Exception\ElementNotFound
param $component @throws ModuleException @deprecated in your tests you can use \Yii::$app directly.
param $link a link text or locator to click
param $name @throws ModuleException if a fixture is not found
params: allows to pass external parameters into module configuration.
paths directories used by Codeception. Default values are:
recreateApplication - (default: false) whether to recreate the whole application before each request You can use this module by setting params in your functional.suite.yml:
recreateApplicationBetweenRequests - (default: false) whether to recreate the whole application before each request
recreateApplicationBetweenTests - (default: false) whether to recreate the whole application before each test

recreateComponents - (default: []) Some components change their state making them unsuitable for processing multiple requests. In production this is usually not a problem since web apps tend to die and start over after each request. This allows you to list application components that need to be recreated before each request. As a consequence, any components specified here should not be changed inside a test since those changes will get regarded. You can use this module by setting params in your functional.suite.yml:
reporters: allows to change default reporters of Codeception

requestCleanMethod - (default: recreate) Method for cleaning the request object. Note that this is only for multiple requests inside a single test case. Between test cases the whole application is always recreated
request_timeout - timeout for a request to return something from remote selenium server (30 seconds by default).

responseCleanMethod - (default: clear) Method for cleaning the response object. Note that this is only for multiple requests inside a single test case. Between test casesthe whole application is always recreated

restart - Set to false (default) to use the same browser window for all tests, or set to true to create a new window for each test. In any case, when all tests are finished the browser window is closed.
result_paracept.xml file will be generated. It can be processed and analyzed.
return string|array The first header value if $first is true, an array of values otherwise
return mixed Boolean false if no mapped file can be loaded, or the name of the mapped file that was loaded.
return mixed the config item’s value or null if it doesn’t exist
return string[] Returns an array containing the name of the CSRF param and the masked CSRF token.

seeInDatabase, dontSeeInDatabase, seeNumRecords, grabFromDatabase and grabNumRecords methods accept arrays as criteria. WHERE condition is generated using item key as a field name and item value as a field value.

settings: provide additional options for test runner. They may dramatically change the way Codeception is executed. For instance, take a note of shuffle option which allows to randomize tests execution order and lint option that toggles parsing a test file (using php -l) before loading it.
start - Autostart a browser for tests. Can be disabled if browser session is started with _initializeSession inside a Helper.
string:date - checks that value is date in JavaScript format: https://weblog.west-wind.com/posts/2014/Jan/06/JavaScript-JSON-Date-Parsing-and-real-Dates
string:email - checks that value is a valid email according to http://emailregex.com/
string:regex({val}) - checks that string matches a regex provided with {val}
string:url - checks that value is valid url.
suite: at the beginning of every suite
suite_namespace: default namespace for new tests of this suite (ignores namespace option)
test: at the beginning of every test
thisissecret will be filled into a form but it won’t be shown in output and logs.
transaction - (default: true) wrap all database connection inside a transaction and roll it back after the test. Should be disabled for acceptance testing..
wait (default: 0 seconds) - Whenever element is required and is not on page, wait for n seconds to find it before fail.
webDriver - instance of \Facebook\WebDriver\Remote\RemoteWebDriver. Can be accessed from Helper classes for complex WebDriver interactions.
window_size - Initial window size. Set to maximize or a dimension in the format 640x480.
writeln - prints to the screen with a new-line character at the end
Please review the code of non-stable modules and provide patches if you have issues.
hidden API method, expected to be used from Helper classes
cleanupBefore: (string, default 'never') - Whether/when to flush the database:
database (int, no default) - The Redis database. Needs to be specified.
Actions start with a plain english verb, like “click” or “fill”. Examples:
Any website can be covered with acceptance tests, even if you use a very exotic CMS or framework.

Each public method of Cest (except those starting with _) will be executed as a test and will receive an instance of the Actor class as the first parameter and the $scenario variable as the second one.
Git Plugin - for building tests for Git repo
Grabbers just read something from the page, but don’t process it. The return value of those are meant to be saved as variables and used later. Example:
Green Balls - to display success results in green.
HOOK executed when test fails but before _after
HOOK triggered after module is created and configuration is loaded
HTML Publisher Plugin - to process Codeception HTML reports

Methods of actor classes are generally taken from Codeception Modules. Each module provides predefined actions for different testing purposes, and they can be combined to fit the testing environment. Codeception tries to solve 90% of possible testing issues in its modules, so you don’t have to reinvent the wheel. We think that you can spend more time on writing tests and less on writing support code to make those tests run. By default, AcceptanceTester relies on PhpBrowser module, which is set in the tests/acceptance.suite.yml configuration file:
This method drops message from queueThis method will wait for message. If none is sent the script will stuck.
This scenario can be performed either by PhpBrowser or by a “real” browser through Selenium WebDriver.
To create a mock, pass current testcase name as last argument:
To update a snapshot with a new data run tests in --debug mode.
xUnit Plugin, jUnit Plugin - to process and display Codeception XML reports
@return object - mock @throws \RuntimeException when class does not exist @throws \Exception
@throws ModuleException if no page was opened.
@throws ModuleException if the key does not exist

A full database clean-up can be painfully slow if you use large database dumps. It is recommended to do more data testing on the functional and integration levels, this way you can get performance bonuses from using ORM.
A group class can be created with php vendor/bin/codecept generate:group groupname command. Group classes will be stored in the tests/_support/Group directory.
A group class can be enabled just like you enable an extension class. In the file codeception.yml:
A group file can be included by its relative filename:

A group object is built to listen for these events. It is useful when an additional setup is required for some of your tests. Let’s say you want to load fixtures for tests that belong to the admin group:
A list of tests for the group can be passed from a Group file. It should be defined in plain text with test names on separate lines:

A nice feature of Codeception is that most scenarios are similar, no matter of how they are executed. PhpBrowser was emulating browser requests but how to execute such test in a real browser like Chrome or Firefox? Selenium WebDriver can drive them so in our acceptance tests we can automate scenarios we used to test manually. In such tests, we should concentrate more on testing the UI than on testing functionality.
A test created by the generate:test command will look like this:
A typical unit test may look like this:

A very similar approach can be used for all frameworks that have an ORM implementing the ActiveRecord pattern. In Yii2 and Phalcon, the methods haveRecord, seeRecord, dontSeeRecord work in the same way. They also should be included by specifying part: ORM in order to not use the functional testing actions.
A/B testing is disabled by default. To enable it you should add corresponding step decorators to suite config:
API tests can be functional and be executed using Symfony, Laravel5, Zend, or any other framework module. You will need slightly update configuration for it:

Acceptance testing can be performed by a non-technical person. That person can be your tester, manager or even client. If you are developing a web-application (and you probably are) the tester needs nothing more than a web browser to check that your site works correctly. You can reproduce an acceptance tester’s actions in scenarios and run them automatically. Codeception keeps tests clean and simple as if they were recorded from the words of an actual acceptance tester.
Accepts either name of class or object of that class
Accepts the active JavaScript native popup window, as created by window.alert|window.confirm|window.prompt. Don’t confuse popups with modal windows, as created by various libraries.

Actions are also quite simple. Every action you define is a public function. Write a public method, then run the build command, and you will see the new function added into the FunctionalTester class.
Actions as array are recommended for simple to combine “waitForElement” with assertions; waitForElement($el) and see('text', $el) can be simplified to:
Actions executed from array or ActionSequence will print debug output for actions, and adds an action name to exception on failure.
Actions for checking the page title:
Actor classes include generated steps taken from corresponding modules and helpers. You can introduce wrappers for those steps by using step decorators.
Add a binding to the Laravel service container. (https://laravel.com/docs/master/container)
Add a contextual binding to the Laravel service container. (https://laravel.com/docs/master/container)
Add a message to a queue/tube
Add a queue to purge list
Add a singleton binding to the Laravel service container. (https://laravel.com/docs/master/container)
Add an instance binding to the Laravel service container. (https://laravel.com/docs/master/container)
Additional Chrome options can be set in goog:chromeOptions capabilities. Note that Selenium 3.8 renamed this capability from chromeOptions to goog:chromeOptions.
Additionally, checkbox values can be checked with a boolean.
Adds Bearer authentication via access token.
Adds NTLM authentication via username/password. Requires client to be Guzzle >=6.3.0 Out of scope for functional modules.
Adds a base directory for a namespace prefix.
Adds custom filter to JsonType list. You should specify a name and parameters of a filter.
Adds entity to repository and flushes. You can redefine it’s properties with the second parameter.
After a request the whole application is available for inspection / interaction.
After configuring the URL we can run this test with the run command:

After the c3.php file is included in application you can start gather coverage. In case you execute your application locally there is nothing to be changed in config. All codecoverage reports will be collected as usual and merged afterwards. Think of it: Codeception runs remote coverage in the same way as local.
After the parallelRun method is defined you can execute tests with
After you create build project you should define build step with Codeception which is
All PHPUnit printers implement the PHPUnit_Framework_TestListener interface. It is recommended to read the code of the original reporter before overriding it.
All SSL certification checks are disabled by default. Use Guzzle request options to configure certifications and others.

All actions and assertions that can be performed by the Actor object in a class are defined in modules. It might look like Codeception limits you in testing, but that’s not true. You can extend the testing suite with your own actions and assertions, by writing them into a custom module, called a Helper. We will get back to this later in this chapter, but for now let’s look at the following test:

All actions and assertions that can be performed by the Tester object in a class are defined in modules. You can extend the testing suite with your own actions and assertions by writing them into a custom module.
All hooks are defined in Codeception\Module and are listed here. You are free to redefine them in your module.
Allows to define initial module config. Can be used in _beforeSuite hook of Helpers or Extensions
Allows to explicitly exclude actions from module.
Allows to explicitly set what methods have this class.
Allows to redefine config for a specific test. Config is restored at the end of a test.
Allows to send REST request using AWS Authorization
Also check all available Public Properties of the used modules to get full access to their data.
Also note that this differs from PhpBrowser, in that

Also, the -c option allows you to specify another config file to be used. Thus, you can have several codeception.yml files for your test suite (e.g. to to specify different environments and settings). Just pass the .yml filename as the -c parameter to execute tests with specific config settings.

Also, you may add Codeception\Verify for BDD-style assertions. This tiny library adds more readable assertions, which is quite nice, if you are always confused about which argument in assert calls is expected and which one is actual:

Alternative reporters can be implemented as extension. There are DotReporter and SimpleReporter extensions included. Use them to change output or use them as an example to build your own reporter. They can be easily enabled with --ext option
Alternatively an array can be used:

Alternatively you can provide the full path to test file:
Alternatively, Mockery can be used inside Codeception.
Alternatively, a function can be passed as parameter:
Alternatively, this can be executed using a callback, in this case the WebDriver instance is passed as argument
Alternatively, you may run tests in shuffle without changing the config:

And finally to execute testing in parallel you should define how you split your tests and run parallel processes for docker-compose. Here we split tests by suites, but you can use different groups to split your tests. In section below you will learn how to do that with Robo.

Applies OR operator to any number of CSS or XPath selectors. You can mix up CSS and XPath selectors here.
As a result the Locator will produce a mixed XPath value that will be used in fillField action.
As always, you can run the newly created test with this command:
As an alternative you can use 3rd-party TeamCity extension for better reporting.
As in scenario-driven functional or acceptance tests you can access Actor class methods. If you write integration tests, it may be useful to include the Db module for database testing.

As it was mentioned, feature files is not just a user story. By writing features in formal language called Gherkin we can execute those scenarios as automated tests. There is no restrictions in the way how those scenarios are supposed to be tested. Tests can be executed at functional, acceptance, or domain level. However, we will concentrate on acceptance or UI tests in current guide.

As we can see this simple story highlights core concepts that are called contracts. We should fulfill those contracts to model software correctly. But how we can verify that those contracts are being satisfied? Cucumber introduced a special language for such stories called Gherkin. Same story transformed to Gherkin will look like this:
As we generated snippets for missing steps with gherkin:snippets command, we will define them in AcceptanceTester file.

As we mentioned earlier, steps should be defined inside context classes. By default all the steps are defined inside an Actor class, for instance, AcceptanceTester. However, you can include more contexts. This can be configured inside global codeception.yml or suite configuration file:
As we mentioned, the _failed hook can help in debugging a failed test. You have the opportunity to save the current test’s state and show it to the user, but you are not limited to this.

As you see, Cest classes have no parents. This is done intentionally. It allows you to extend your classes with common behaviors and workarounds that may be used in child classes. But don’t forget to make these methods protected so they won’t be executed as tests.
As you see, the syntax is the same for functional and acceptance tests.
As you see, this class is very simple. It extends the AcceptanceTester class, meaning it can access all the methods and properties of AcceptanceTester.
As you see, we are passing the Actor object into tryToTest method. This allows us to write scenarios the way we did before:
As you see, you can freely change markup of your login page, and all the tests interacting with this page will have their locators updated according to properties of LoginPage class.
Assert that a session variable exists.
Assert that a specific form error message is set in the view.
Assert that form errors are bound to the View.
Assert that specific form error messages are set in the view.
Assert that the session has a given list of values.
Assert that there are no form errors bound to the View.
Assertion methods come from PHPUnit. See the complete reference at phpunit.de.
Assertions can be a bit tricky. First of all, it’s recommended to prefix all your assertion actions with see or dontSee.
Asserts that a given key contains a given item
Asserts that a given key does not contain a given item
Asserts that a key does not exist or, optionally, that it doesn’t have the provided $value
Asserts that a key exists, and optionally that it has the provided $value
Asserts that a row with the given column values exists. Provide table name and column values.
Asserts that an element in a collection exists and is an Array
Asserts that an element in a collection exists and is an Object
Asserts that current page has 404 response status code.
Asserts that the given number of records were found in the database.
Asserts that there is no record with the given column values in a database. Provide table name and column values.
